intro: Leucas plukenetii, commonly known as the African sunflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Leucas plukenetii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
